title: Afghan Refugees Can Be Sponsored by Private Citizens Under New Program
sub_head: State Department will screen applicants as huge backlog overwhelms resettlement agencies
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Private citizens will be allowed to sponsor Afghan families under a new program launched Monday by the Biden administration, as overwhelmed agencies have left thousands stuck on military bases in harsh conditions waiting to be resettled.
The Sponsor Circle Program will be run along with a nonprofit that was set up last month to help refugees settle in the U.S., filling the role of traditional resettlement agencies. The program will allow private citizens to group together to sponsor families and help them access housing and other necessities like food, clothing and education.
